name: Great Shoe Lake
description: You reach the foot of a pointed mountain range. A trail continues up into the hills. It curves along a large oblong lake. Here and there the water bubbles violently before returning to silence.

name: Tsu Valley
description: Beyond the first few hills the trail leads into a large valley. On the far side you can see a castle town. Farm houses dot the landscape before you. There's a forest to the south with trees of similar sizes neatly arranged in rows.

unlockableAreas.buttonText: Follow the road toward the castle

buildings.name: Tsu Farms
buildings.description: A simple house stands surrounded by a patch of trees. An old man and woman are working in the garden as you approach. Around the house there are a quite a few farm animals grazing, including a number of very woolly sheep.
actions: Shear Sheep:Wool:You begin shearing a sheep.

name: Tree Nursery
description: You enter the tree nursery. There are many trees perfect for chopping all around you, though it appears as though they are owned by someone else.

name: West Tsu City
description: The city is surrounded by a great wall. The only entrance is a massive gate, colored bright red. As you enter you find a large temple complex covers the western region. The main road leads directly to the center of town, where a massive castle towers over the little houses.

buildings.name: Tsu Smithy
buildings.description: The smithy here is massive and can heat any metal strong enough to withstand it.

name: Central Tsu City
description: The center of the city is bustling with activity. There are a number of businesses along the sides of the road.

unlockableAreas.buttonText: Continue on the main road east

buildings.name: Tsu Castle
buildings.description: The castle towers over the city below. The guards here are willing to train anyone in the art of archery.

buildings.name: Tawaya's Tannery
buildings.description: This large tannery has a public use area. You can tan hides and make jerky here.

name: North Tsu City
description: The north of the city is mostly residential, but it is also home to the Alchemist's Guild, the only place where alchemy is studied in the whole land.

buildings.name: Alchemy Guild
buildings.description: As you approach the entrance you find a large sign posted on the door. "CLOSED FOR RENOVATIONS"

name: East Tsu City
description: The eastern wing of the city is the market district. All sorts of useless bobbles and toys are for sale for the many tourists who pass by here every year on their way to one of the great cities to the east.

buildings.name: Elemental Emporium
buildings.description: The shop is dark. Its only light source comes from colored torches on each wall. It's clearly for show, as the shop owner seems to have no idea about alchemy at all.

buildings.name: Archery Shop
buildings.description: The shop is full of archery equipment, no surprises there. The only thing out of place is the extraordinarily large teddy bear lofted behind the counter with two arrows sticking out from its chest.

buildings.name: Artisan Guild
buildings.description: The guild is expansive, though non-members are only allowed in the lobby. You can exchange your reward points for a few different items here.

name: Tangei Gardens
description: The gardens are ancient, and have been used as a place of quiet relaxation and meditation for as long as people have lived in Tsu. You can practice yoga here as well.
conversionActions: Draw water:Bucket of Water:Empty Bucket:You begin drawing water from the garden lake.
